pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:0.5: 5. The training rule on the same sleeping place
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.2: At that time the lay followers were going to the monastery to listen to the Teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.3: When the instruction was over, the senior monks went to their own dwellings,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.4: but the newly ordained monks went to sleep right there in the assembly hall together with the lay followers—absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.5: The lay followers complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.6: “How can the venerables go to sleep absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.7: The monks heard the complaints of those lay followers,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.8: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.9: “How can those monks sleep in the same sleeping place as people who are not fully ordained?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.10: After rebuking those newly ordained monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha assembled and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that monks do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.14: “… How can those foolish men sleep in the same sleeping place as people who are not fully ordained?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.15: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.16: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.17: ‘If a monk sleeps in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.18: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.1: After staying at Āḷavī for as long as he wanted, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kosambī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.2: When he eventually arrived at Kosambī, he stayed at the Badarikā Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.3: Just then the monks said to Venerable Rāhula,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.4: “Rāhula, the Buddha has laid down a training rule that we can’t sleep in the same sleeping place as a person who’s not fully ordained.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.6: Since Rāhula was not able to get a sleeping place, he lay down to sleep in the restroom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.7: Then, after rising early in the morning, the Buddha went to the restroom, where he cleared his throat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.12: Rāhula told the Buddha what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.13: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.14: “Monks, I allow you to sleep in the same sleeping place as a person who isn’t fully ordained for two or three nights.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.15: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.16: ‘If a monk sleeps in excess of two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.20: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.21: A person who is not fully ordained:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.22: anyone except a fully ordained monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.23: In excess of two or three nights:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.28: fully roofed, fully walled; mostly roofed, mostly walled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.29: Sleeps […] in the same sleeping place:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.30: at dawn on the fourth day: if he lies down when the person who is not fully ordained is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.31: if the person who is not fully ordained lies down when he is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.32: if they both lie down together, he commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.33: every time they get up and then lie down again, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.1: If it is someone who is not fully ordained, and the monk perceives him as not fully ordained, and he sleeps in the same sleeping place as him in excess of two or three nights, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.2: If it is someone who is not fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, and he sleeps in the same sleeping place as him in excess of two or three nights, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.3: If it is someone who is not fully ordained, but the monk perceives him as fully ordained, and he sleeps in the same sleeping place as him in excess of two or three nights, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.4: If it is half-roofed and half-walled, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.5: If it is someone who is fully ordained, but the monk perceives him as not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.6: If it is someone who is fully ordained, but the monk is unsure if he is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.7: If it is someone who is fully ordained, and the monk perceives him as fully ordained, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.2: if he stays together for two or three night;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.3: if he stays together for less than two or three nights;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.4: if, after staying together for two nights, he leaves before dawn on the third night and then stays together again;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.5: if it is fully roofed, but not walled;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.6: if it is fully walled, but not roofed;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.7: if it is mostly not roofed;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.8: if it is mostly not walled;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.9: if the monk sits when the person who is not fully ordained is lying down;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.10: if the person who is not fully ordained sits when the monk is lying down;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.14: The fifth rule, the training rule on the same sleeping place, is finished.
